page.title: 02LOCAL HISTORY ERDINGTON
page.content: In Anglo Saxon times Erdington was a small village owned by Edwin Earl of Mercia. In 1066 William Fitzansculf received Erdington. Old street names go back to Roman times, e.g. Chester Road. Station Road was once called Sheep Street, Holly Lane was once a footpath. Erdington developed quickly in the nineteenth century with the building of the railway from Birmingham to Sutton Coldfield.Many fine bridges were built and Erdington became a wealthy suburb. Roman Catholicism has been strong in Erdington since Irish immigration but Mass was said in houses until the Abbey Church was founded in 1850 by Father Haigh. In 1875 monks came to England from Germany. The CATHOLIC SCHOOLS began in 1845.
